page.title: 11The Mill becomes an Inn
page.content: The mill was fed by water from the River Coln which was diverted into a mill pond.This area of the hotel today is called the Waterwheel Bar,which is totally modern.But part of the present building without doubt incorporates parts of the original mill.Ale was the common drink in medieval England and although the peasant brewed some in his home from his own crop of barley, the ale for communal feastings were brewed at the mill which became the village ale house. There,at the Frogmill,were brewed the Easter and the Whitsun ales,and other ales for other feast days.For at least 1000 years ale has been drunk in the Frogmill.It is probable that the miller turned innkeeper early in the eighteenth century when stage coaches first operated on these roads.
